thread.title: Calvert gets second chance for junior provincial berth
thread.title_full: Calvert gets second chance for junior provincial berth

title: Calvert gets second chance for junior provincial berth
text:
Calvert gets second chance for junior provincial berth By: Uncredited Report Error 
Carberry native Braden Calvert and his Winnipeg-based team will play for a berth in the provincial junior men’s curling championship in Stonewall tonight. 
Calvert and his team of Kyle Kurz, Connor McIntyre and Colin Kurz lost their first berth playoff game 7-1 to Hayden Forrester on Sunday. They will play Derek Oryniak for the second spot at 7 o’clock. 
Brandon’s Shayne MacGranachan and Chase Dusessoy fell in the quarter-finals for the second spot. 
In the junior women’s event, Minnedosa native Jennifer Curle fell 10-4 to Abby Ackland in the semifinal for the second berth. Rebecca Lamb and Ackland earned spots at provincials. 
At the Lloyd Gunnlaugson Memorial bonspiel in Winnipeg, Bob Sigurdson earned a berth to senior provincials with a 7-3 win over Carl German. Deloraine’s Kelly McMechan fell 7-1 to Sigurdson in the semifinals. McMechan won $600. 
Meanwhile, Brandon’s Tiffany McLean posted a 1-3 record and missed the playoffs at the World Curling Tour’s Canad Inns Women’s Classic in Portage la Prairie. South Korea’s EunJung Kim beat Jennifer Jones in the final.
